instructions: # Savage Worlds Tabbed Character Sheet### Now with International Language Support!!## Character Sheet Features & Capabilities* Toggle between Wild Card and Mook using the button in the upper left-hand corner  * The Mook and Wild Card sheets are the same sheet, allowing universal macros;   * The Mook sheet will not roll a Wild Die when using the buttons on the sheet.  * A banner indicates the type of character the sheet is for (Mook vs. Wild Card)* The Stat Block button whispers the entire stat block of the character to the Chat window—this stat block includes Ability Command Buttons so rolls can be made directly from the Chat window.* Configuration the sheet to fit the Setting being played* Game Setting Defaults can be configured (SEE BELOW THIS MESSAGE)## ConfigurationTo configure the sheet to meet your needs, click the Gear icon. In the configuration section you can:* Configure Initiative modifying Edges for the DealInit API Script* Indicate the character has certain rule altering edges (such as Nerves of Steel or Fleet-Footed)* Change the Background and logo* Quick Setting Configuration for various Game Settings* Configure Optional & Home Brew Rules## Attributes & Skills* All skills from the Savage Worlds Core Deluxe rules are included in the sheet, but are hidden by default. To manage them, click on the "+/- Core Skills" button on the Skills tab (right above Fighting) and place a check mark next to each skill you'd like to use.    - Skill Specialization Fencing Styles and Schools are supported* You can mouse over just about any field to get its attribute name. * All field titles follow Roll20's attribute syntax, ie. Agility would be displayed as "@{agility}" on mouse-over.## Rolls* You can mouse over any button to get its ability name.* Roll button titles DO NOT follow Roll20's ability syntax, using the selected token, ie. "%{selected|STR-check}", but will only show the attribute displayed like "@{AgilityRoll}".* The gm button uses the exact same formula for rolling as the regular button, but will whisper the roll to the GM.---## Special ThanksI'd like to thank the following for their help in the development of this sheet:* Actoba* herrozerro* Brian (CSS wizard)* Sam MarinoI stole a lot of css/html from them* Felipe FFor implementing the i18n stuff so the sheet can be translated into other languages.

useroptions.description: Check this box if the number of raises on an attack roll change the bonus die type.  This option will change the Raise check box to a drop down menu, allowing the user to select which die type to roll for the bonus damage. This impacts weapons and Spells.
Check this box to use the Skill Specialization Setting Rule.

useroptions.displayname: Hose rule: Roll for Extra Experience Points
useroptions.description: Enables the button for rolling for extra XP based on unspent/spent bennies.
